intro: Ceratostema buxifolium, commonly known as the boxleaf ceratostema, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Sarcandraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with small, leathery leaves resembling those of boxwood. The plant produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive appearance. Ceratostema buxifolium prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant.
